pullRequest.body:
The lemmas around here are a mess. Rename `Finset.exists_smaller_set` to `Finset.exists_subset_card_eq`, `Finset.exists_intermediate_set` to `Finset.exists_subsuperset_card_eq`, and add the missing third `Finset.exists_superset_card_eq`. Same for `Set`.


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

> I'm surprised they've lasted this long :)

I am a very powerful procrastiner 😇

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge
Canceled.

Uh, I'm not sure why it was canceled.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9662353710/job/26652053687)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9662353710/job/26652054869)
Haha, I think these lemmas were some of my earliest mathlib PRs. I was surprised at the time that the names were accepted, and I'm surprised they've lasted this long :)
bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (hnα : n ≤ Fintype.card α) : ```

```suggestion
lemma Finset.exists_superset_card_eq [Fintype α] {n : ℕ} {s : Finset α} (hsn : s.card ≤ n)
```
Probably `omega` works here?
This is growing the set, not shrinking it!
I guess there's a cleaner proof by induction on hnt,  but it's up to you which you pick.
Sadly I did not manage to get `Nat.le_induction` to work

Here's the shorter proof I was hoping for:
```
  classical
  refine Nat.decreasingInduction' ?_ hnt ⟨t, by simp [hst]⟩
  intro k _ hnk ⟨u, hu₁, hu₂, hu₃⟩
  obtain ⟨a, ha⟩ : (u \ s).Nonempty := by rw [←card_pos, card_sdiff hu₁]; omega
  simp only [mem_sdiff] at ha
  exact ⟨u.erase a, by simp [subset_erase, erase_subset_iff_of_mem (hu₂ _), *]⟩
  ```
Ah, that's not induction *on* `hnt` but induction *using* `hnt`!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Improve lemmas about sets of intermediate size
